Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
app.tracktune.view.ViewManager
public class ViewManager extends Object
Dedicated class to manage view part of the MVC pattern

      public ViewManager()

  • Method Details

    • initView

      public static void initView(String viewPath) throws IOException
      Initializes and displays a JavaFX view specified by the given FXML path.

      Sets the stage with fixed dimensions, title, and icons. Typically used for the login or initial views.

      Parameters:
      viewPath - the path to the FXML view file to be loaded.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the FXML file cannot be loaded.

    • redirectView

      public static void redirectView(String viewPath, double frameWidth, double frameHeight)
      Redirects the application to a new JavaFX view with a smooth fade transition.

      This method first fades out the current scene, loads the new scene from the provided FXML path, and then fades in the new scene. It also adjusts the stage size and position based on the given dimensions.

      Parameters:
      viewPath - the path to the FXML file of the new view
      frameWidth - the desired width of the new stage frame
      frameHeight - the desired height of the new stage frame

    • setAndShowAlert

      public static void setAndShowAlert(String title, String header, String content, javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type)
      Set and show a specific alert
      Parameters:
      title - : Title to be shown
      header - : Header to be shown
      content - : Content to be shown
      type - : Type of alert

    • setAndGetConfirmAlert

      public static boolean setAndGetConfirmAlert(String title, String header, String content)
      Displays a confirmation dialog with custom title, header, and content text.

      The dialog includes two buttons: one for cancellation and one for confirmation (typically "Delete"). Custom styles are applied from an external CSS stylesheet.

      Parameters:
      title - the title of the alert dialog
      header - the header text (can be null)
      content - the content text to display in the dialog
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms (presses the confirm/delete button), false otherwise

    • showReplyDialog

      public static Optional<String> showReplyDialog()
      Displays a text input dialog prompting the user to reply to a comment.

      A simple input box appears with a placeholder and custom style.

      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user's input if confirmed, or empty if cancelled

    • showSegmentCommentDialog

      public static Optional<String[]> showSegmentCommentDialog()
      Displays a custom dialog that allows the user to add a segment-based comment.

      The dialog includes input fields for:

      • Start time of the segment (required)
      • End time of the segment (optional, defaults to "0" if empty)
      • The comment text
      Styled using a custom CSS theme, the dialog returns the user input upon confirmation.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing a String[] of three elements:
      1. start time
      2. end time ("0" if not provided)
      3. comment text
      or an empty Optional if the user cancels the dialog

    • navigateToLogin

      public static void navigateToLogin()
      Navigates to the login view.

      The stage is made non-resizable and not fullscreen before redirecting.

    • navigateToAccountRequest

      public static void navigateToAccountRequest()
      Navigates to the account request view.

      The stage is made non-resizable and not fullscreen before redirecting.

    • navigateToAdminDashboard

      public static void navigateToAdminDashboard()
      Navigates to the admin dashboard view.

      The stage is made resizable before redirecting.

    • navigateToUserDashboard

      public static void navigateToUserDashboard()
      Navigates to the standard user dashboard view.

      The stage is made resizable before redirecting.

    • navigateToPendingUserDashboard

      public static void navigateToPendingUserDashboard()
      Navigates to the pending user dashboard view.

      The stage is made resizable before redirecting.

    • setMainContent

      public static void setMainContent(String contentPath, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane mainContent, Controller parentController)
      Sets the main content area of the dashboard to display a new view. The new view is loaded from the specified FXML file path.
      Parameters:
      contentPath - Path to the FXML file to load and display in the main content area
      mainContent - The main content node from the entrypoint of the view (dashboard or something like that)
      parentController - If there is a child controller loaded by a parent, the parent has to be passed as parameter to the child

    • initSessionManager

      public static void initSessionManager(User sessionUser)
      Initializes the SessionManager with the provided user.
      Parameters:
      sessionUser - the user to associate with the session

    • getSessionUser

      public static User getSessionUser()
      Retrieves the current session user.
      Returns:
      the User associated with the current session, or null if not initialized

    • logout

      public static void logout()
      Logs out the current session.

      Resets the SessionManager and navigates back to the login view.
